sections.MISSION:
1/2CR Reconnaissance Platoon conducts M4 group and zero, MK22, M2010, day and night qualification and M240L familiarization fire on 09 October 2024 to build confidence in primary weapon systems and improve combat readiness.
Commander’s
sections.PURPOSE: of this range is to provide the Recon Platoon with the opportunity to participate for familiarization training, Data collection, and Rapid Target Engagement Practices.
sections.KEY TASKS:
Conduct group and zero M4 Iron Sights
Conduct Weapon System Familiarization and gather data
Conduct Rapid Target Engagement
MG Teams Familiarization Fire
sections.END STATE:
The Recon Platoon successfully conducts M4 Iron Sight group and zero to practice the first graded Sniper School event. The Platoon will also become familiarized with the three main weapon systems as well as proficient in rapid target engagement and data collection.
Training Objectives
Conduct M4 Iron Sight 25 Meter Group and Zero
Conduct daytime Sniper system familiarization
Gather data for future engagements
Conduct night Sniper system familiarization Conduct rapid target engagement techniques
Gather data and practice for Sniper School
MG Team Drills MG Familiarization Fire 600m – 1000m on Tripod

subtasks.hazard: Improper handling of ammunition or explosives

values: Leaders ensure individuals who handle ammunition and pyrotechnics are trained on proper handling procedures and safety.
Soldiers must handle all ammunition with care.
Soldiers must wear eye protection and gloves while handing pyrotechnics, ammunition and crating/packaging material.
Leaders must enforce no smoking except in designated areas.
Have two ten (10) pound fire extinguisher(s) on hand at ammo point.
Separate blank/live DODICs by placement on separate pads
Ammo shakedown will be conducted after every iteration to ensure all ammunition is accounted for and only the proper ammunition is used for the following iteration
All Soldiers will be trained on the use of pyrotechnics prior to use
Leaders ensure Blank Firing Adapters are removed from weapon systems between blank and live iterations.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: Initial Risk Assessment: The overall initial risk is assessed as medium due to the infrequent probability of critical events.Residual Risk Assessment: The overall residual risk is assessed as low, attributed to the unlikely probability of critical events with effective control measures in place.Most Dangerous Risk: Negligent DischargeMitigation: Soldiers will use selector switch discipline and only place the weapon system on fire prior to engaging targets. Upon completion of each engagement, selector switches will be placed on safe. Safeties will control the direction and safety for each shooter. Safeties will clear each weapon system before it is removed from the firing line.Most Likely Risk: Slips, Trips, and FallsMitigation: Mitigating the risk of slips, trips, and falls involves ensuring the correct usage of PPE during operations and reducing the speed of nonessential movements. Additionally, part of the mitigation strategy involves briefing soldiers on prevailing weather conditions and empowering them to identify and rectify any surfaces deemed unsafe before and during training events.
